t: Thus*p the Lord God*s showed me: Behold, a basket of summer fruit.
And He said, “Amos, what do you see?” So*p I said, “A basket of summer fruit.” Then*p the Lord*s said to me: “The*pn end has come upon My people Israel; I*ld will not pass by them anymore.
And*ld the songs of the temple Shall*ld be wailing in that day,” Says*ld the Lord God—*s “Many*ld dead bodies everywhere, They*ld shall be thrown out in silence.”
Hear*ln this, you who swallow up the needy, And*ld make the poor of the land fail,

Saying:*p “When*pn will the New Moon be past, That*ld we may sell grain? And*ld the Sabbath, That*ld we may trade wheat? Making*ld the ephah small and the shekel large, Falsifying*ld the scales by deceit,
That*ld we may buy the poor for silver, And*ld the needy for a pair of sandals— Even*ld sell the bad wheat?”
The*ln Lord*s has sworn by the pride of Jacob: “Surely*ld I will never forget any of their works.
Shall*ld the land not tremble for this, And*ld everyone mourn who dwells in it? All*ld of it shall swell like the River, Heave*ld and subside Like*ld the River of Egypt.
“And*ln it shall come to pass in that day,” says the Lord God,*s “That*ld I will make the sun go down at noon, And*ld I will darken the earth in broad daylight;

I*ld will turn your feasts into mourning, And*ld all your songs into lamentation; I*ld will bring sackcloth on every waist, And*ld baldness on every head; I*ld will make it like mourning for an only son,*i And*ld its end like a bitter day.
“Behold,*ln the days are coming,” says the Lord God,*s “That*ld I will send a famine on the land, Not*ld a famine of bread, Nor*ld a thirst for water, But*ld of hearing the words of the Lord.*s
They*ld shall wander from sea to sea, And*ld from north to east; They*ld shall run to and fro, seeking the word of the Lord,*s But*ld shall not find it.*i
“In*ln that day the fair virgins And*ld strong young men Shall*ld faint from thirst.
Those*ld who swear by the sin of Samaria, Who*ld say, ‘As*ld your god lives, O Dan!’ And,*ld ‘As the way of Beersheba lives!’ They*ld shall fall and never rise again.”
